Sources in France have revealed Lyon are also privately in favour of having the player’s future resolved rapidly. With Fekir insistent on Anfield being his next destination, this has scuppered any chance of a post-competition auction. (JOE)

Further work will be done to elevate Klopp’s depth of options, with Stoke’s Xherdan Shaqiri - a versatile attacking midfielder capable of filling in further forward - of interest. (JOE)

There is a wealth of admiration for Jan Oblak of Atletico Madrid, but his release clause of £88m is also prohibitive. If there is a opportunity to broker a transfer at more manageable terms, Liverpool would not hesitate to recruit a pedigreed keeper. (JOE)

Melissa Reddy

It is believed that should the transfer go through, Liverpool would pay 55million euros (£48.4m) up front plus a maximum of 5m euros (£4.4m) in add-ons.

The deal could even be completed as early as Friday, although the next 48 hours is seen as critical.
